title: ra.rings and algebras - Global dimension of noetherian rings
body: In the book "An introduction to noncommutative Noetherian rings" by Goodearl and Warfield from 2004 one can find the following two open problem: Is the Krull dimension less than or equal to the global dimension of a noetherian ring? Is the global dimension of a noetherian ring equal to the supremum of the projective dimensions of the simple modules? What is the status of those problems in 2017? ra.rings-and-algebras homological-algebra Share Cite Improve this question Follow edited Jun 15, 2020 at 7:27 Community Bot 1 2 2 silver badges 3 3 bronze badges asked Dec 30, 2017 at 10:23 Mare 28.3k 7 7 gold badges 26 26 silver badges 117 117 bronze badges $\endgroup$ 2 $\begingroup$ Rather than posting here, it would have been simpler to ask Ken Goodearl. $\endgroup$ David Handelman –  David Handelman 2017-12-30 13:45:29 +00:00 Commented Dec 30, 2017 at 13:45 $\begingroup$ Re 1: any counterexample cannot have an Auslander dualising complex. $\endgroup$ user91132 –  user91132 2018-01-02 15:49:05 +00:00 Commented Jan 2, 2018 at 15:49 Add a comment  |  0 Sorted by: Reset to default Highest score (default) Date modified (newest first) Date created (oldest first) You must log in to answer this question.
